intro: Radicula sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower radicula, is a small flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tiny, clustered flowers and a basal rosette of leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
